posts.cooked:
When the robot is facing forward, it drives forward, backward, left, and right correctly.

When using driveFieldOrientedDirectAngle, the rotation is reversed. Moving the right joystick to the right rotates the robot to the left and vice versa. In addition, when the robot is rotated, moving the left joystick forward does not move the robot forward relative to the field and chooses some other direction: When the robot is turned 90 degrees all around, forward becomes backward, and backward becomes forward.

For reference, we use PS4 controllers and needed to invert a value or two in RobotContainer for it to drive correctly. Here is our repo: https://github.com/WESSAvner/9636-Reefscape-2025

link_counts.title: GitHub - WESSAvner/9636-Reefscape-2025: 9636 code for the 2025 FRC game Reefscape.

posts.cooked: Did you do the eight steps yet?
I want to say we have, especially since it feels like less of a motor inversion problem, and more of a IMU problem, like it isn’t able to tell where the field is supposed to be.
It could be either. Go through the eight steps again if you can
Alright, next time I can I will go through all the steps.

I’ll write what fixed it for people who have similar problems: I swapped frontleft and backright code and swapped frontright and backleft code for it rotating the wrong way I inverted IMU to fix the driving in the wrong direction when turned. Many thanks

posts.name: Jason Johnson
posts.cooked:
We are having this an  issue.  We select when BLUE alliance forward/back and left/right are correct but rotate on right stick makes robot rotate the wrong way.  That is left on right stick is CW rotation and right on right stick is CCW rotation.

Can you clarify what is meant by swapping front left to back right code and front right to back left?  Was code changed or the JSON files updated?

Also, what did you do to address the IMU?

image 1004×439 23.4 KB

image 1004×439 23.4 KB

image 1004×439 23.4 KB

This diagram from the YAGSL 8 steps shows exactly what I did. In the bottom of the 8 steps page on the YAGSL website, it gives good instructions on how to swap them around.

posts.name: Jason Johnson
posts.cooked:
I reviewed our code last year and noticed that both the left and right joystick inputs were inverted for field oriented angular velocity.

I reviewed the 2025 YAGSL example (code we used for swerve drive) and it inverts the left stick but not the right stick.  Hence, left on stick is going CW and not CCW.

I posted a question about how to invert and received guidance.  Going to try it out tonight

YAGSL: Steam.of need to rotate right stick Java
